column2: Deploy [Root.GetFullName] in combat. But beware, it could be hurt or even killed and if there is a dragon rider on the enemy side it might intervene..
Deploy [Root.GetFullName] in siege. But beware, it could be hurt or even killed.
You face [Root.GetFullName] and attempt to tame it.
You face [Root.GetFullName] and attempt to slay it.
You cannot possess more than one dragon, and the dragon you wish to ride must be untamed.
You must be in command of an ongoing battle and your dragon must not be wounded.
You must be in command of a siege and your dragon must not be wounded.

You acquired a dragon egg and can try to hatch it. However, a dragon is not a toy, you need to be careful since the neighbouring lords will fear you and will be more likely to form coaltions against you.

You and [your_dragon.GetFullName] enter the battlefield. The enemy holds its breath as [your_dragon.GetFullName] floods the sky and the ground with fire. The enemy soldiers melt with their armor, or flee from the flying inferno. The day is yours!
The enemy has garrisoned himself within his holding. But castles are not dragon-proof! The flames of [your_dragon.GetFullName] devour the castle, killing scores of men, women, and children.
Your enemy, [From.GetFullName], flies his dragon into battle and steers him straight towards you.
Your enemy, [From.GetFullName], flies his dragon into battle and steers him straight towards you.

[your_dragon.GetFullName] destroys soldier after soldier and transforms the former grass field into a field of fire. Those who are not devoured by the flames carry wounds and scars from it. Some of their commanders and noblemen had a dance with the fire and got away with it, if at all.

[your_dragon.GetFullName] destroys soldier after soldier and transforms the former stone wall into a field of fire. Those who are not devoured by the flames carry wounds and scars from it. Some of their commanders and noblemen had a dance with the fire and got away with it, if at all.

Your dragon's power is undeniable. In order to prevent the enemy forces of taking back the holding and entrenching themselves in it we can melt the walls and tear down some buildings or we kill everybody in it and burn every building we can find!
Damage the walls and set some houses on fire!
I just want leave some garrison.
The battle is won! The enemy armies flee from the fire or lie dead at the ground. However, while your soldiers loot the battlefield's aftermath they find enemy soldiers. You offer them a choice...
Some soldiers from of the enemy's side join you.
Riders arrived bringing terrible news.../nOur soldiers were killed by the fire of [your_dragon.GetFullName] ridden by [Root.GetFullName]. They had to suffer unimaginable pain before they died.

You stand before [targetted_dragon_for_taming.GetFirstName] and see the dragon's mighty mouth opening, his teeths tainted with blood and his [targetted_dragon_for_tamin.GetScaleColour] scales shining in the sun as the dragon rises its wings. You approach the beast slowly hoping that it will not devour you.
As you whip the dragon his roaring grows calm. The beast bows his head and wings and it seems like he accepts you as his master.

No matter how hard or how often you you use your whip the dragon seems unyielding. The more you slash upon him the more his rage grows and finally you can see red-orange glow arising from its maw. The flames tace upon you and you feel your skin melt...
Everything has been prepared. You approach the fire with the egg in your hands. I …
… place the egg in the fire.
Small fractures form on the egg and slowly a small nose feels its way out of the egg. A new dragon enters the world.
A dragon has been seen in your demesne! He eats the stock and burns the fields, someting must be done! Locals have tracked it down and found his lair near a river.
There is nothing I can do.
A dragon is a dangerous beast. In order to face this monstrous creature I need to prepare myself properly. I begin with armor, I shall wear...
…a shield like a mirror and some light armor.
My preperation is almost finished. The only thing that is missing is a proper weapon. I will slay the dragon with...

You slowly approach the sleeping [targetted_dragon_for_taming.GetFirstName] as you make your weapon ready to kill the beast. However, your approach is not unnoticed and so [targetted_dragon_for_taming.GetFirstName] awakes and raises his head towards you. The suprise is lost. You can make a final stand or run for your live.

You slowly approach the sleeping [targetted_dragon_for_taming.GetFirstName] as you make your weapon ready to kill the beast. However, your approach is not unnoticed and so [targetted_dragon_for_taming.GetFirstName] awakes and raises his head towards you. You hide behind your shield and the dragon curiously looks at  it seeing only himself. He turns his head away from you leaving his eyes unprotected. This is your chance...
I will thrust my spear in his eye!
You charge for the dragon but its flames surround you and you can fell them melting through your armor and skin and flesh...
With your full strenght you thrust the spear. As it flies time feels like a timelapse and when the spear was repelled by the dragon's scales you knew you missed and moreover you are as good as dead.
With your full strenght you thrust the spear. As it flies time feels like a timelapse and when the spear enters the dragon's eye the lair gets filled by an awful scream as the dragon collapses.
[Root.GetFullName] has finally recovered from his wound and is once again ready for battle.
Unfortunately [Root.GetFullName]'s wound did not heal, in the contrary, the wound grew every month and as a consequence has grown limited in his actions.
That's not good...He hopefully recovers sometimes.
[Root.GetFullName] has finally recovered from his inuries and is once again ready for battle.
As the battle begins, [rider_a.GetFullName] ascends to the sky on his dragon [dragon_a.GetFullName] and sets fire to your army. If you do not intervene, the battle is lost.

The foolish [rider_d.GetFullName] has sat down on his dragon [dragon_d.GetFullName] and flies towards you to prevent your attack on his army. Engaging this fight puts you in great danger but a victory in the air means a victory on the land.
The [rider_d.GetFullName]'s dragon [dragon_d.GetFullName] sets our army on fire. As a dragon rider you can follow your commander in the air and engage the dragon duel.
Your commander [From.GetFullName] joins you in the duel.
As the dragons clash together streams of fire fill the sky. On the ground the armies of both sides fight for victory, but the the real victory is to be won in the air.
The dragons bleed from wounds and their scales turned black from the fire but it is not over ever yet.
The battle goes on and you look out for the enemy rider. As soon as he gets into your sight you make once more ready for attack.
As you maneuver [your_dragon.GetFullName] through the flames you encounter [encounter.GetFullName]. Though your dragon fights as food as he can your foe's strenght is slightly superior.

As you maneuver [your_dragon.GetFullName] through the flames you encounter [encounter.GetFullName]. Though your dragon fights as food as he can your foe's strenght is much stronger. Though [your_dragon.GetFullName] is severly injured he manages to escape. You are safe but your fellow riders do now have to deal with the enemy alone.
As you maneuver [your_dragon.GetFullName] through the flames you encounter [encounter.GetFullName]. Though your dragon fights as food as he can your foe's strenght is superior.

While the battles on the ground seem to last untiringly, the clash of the dragons has come to an end. It now shows more that we have clearly gained the upper hand and that nothing stands in the way of our victory.

While the battles on the ground seem to last untiringly, the clash of dragons has come to an end. It now shows more that the enemy has clearly gained the upper hand and that a retreat is now inevitable.
You went for your daily visits of [From.GetFirstName]. When you took a closer look at his lair you saw something wonderful. An egg!
[Root.GetFirstName] successfully tamed [targetted_dragon_for_taming.GetFullName]. [Root.GetSheHe] now rides him into battle.
[targetted_dragon_for_taming.GetFullName]'s could not be mastered. The dragon unleashed its furry and burned [Root.GetFirstName] to death.
[Root.GetSheHe] had no chance to take cover when [your_dragon.GetFullName] was deployed onto the battlefield and unleashed a blanket of fire.
Known for [Root.GetHerHis] bravery [Root.GetSheHe] died attempting to tame [Killer.GetFirstName].
Though [Root.GetFirstName] was a dragon lord the enemy's strength was overwhelming.
[Root.GetFirstName] was a brave [Root.GetManWoman]. She faced the dragon $KILLER$ but was burned to death by its fire.
[Root.GetFirstName] was a brave [Root.GetManWoman]. She faced the dragon $KILLER$ but when [Root.GetSheHe] tried to flee from it out of fear the dragon devoured [Rott.GetHerHim].
Burned to death by the fire of $KILLER$'s dragon
was burnt alive by $KILLER$ when [Root.GetSheHe] attempted to tame it
was slain in an epic dragon duel by $KILLER$
burned to death by the fire of $KILLER$ when trying to kill it
burned to death by the fire of $KILLER$ when trying to flee from it
This is a dragon. Dragons are monstrous fire-breathing scaly creatures. They are the symbol of power of the Freehold.

Dragon Riders are feared sights on the field of battle. When they engage the fighting with their dragons no shield wall can hold off the the inferno.\nThis rider is pretty new to dragon riding. He does not have much experience and still needs to learn.

Dragon Riders are feared sights on the field of battle. When they engage the fighting with their dragons no shield wall can hold off the the inferno.\nThis rider got some experience with battles and duels on his dragon. He knows how to maneuver his dragon through struggle without getting themselves wounded.

Dragon Riders are feared sights on the field of battle. When they engage the fighting with their dragons no shield wall can hold off the the inferno.\nA well-trained dragon rider who has almost perfected riding is a dreaded sight in battle. An open fight with him should be avoided.

Dragon Riders are feared sights on the field of battle. When they engage the fighting with their dragons no shield wall can hold off the the inferno.\nA well-trained dragon rider who has perfected riding is a dreaded sight in battle. He truly is one of the best dragon riders in the world.
This character was badly disfigured by a dragon.
This character has commited a mass killing. A crime despised by men of all religions alike.
This character has killed one of the most dangerous creatures in the know world, a dragon. Whenever on the battlefield Dragon Lords fear his sight.
The dragon is wounded giving him a disadvantage in combat. However, now it is easier to tame.
The dragon is maimed giving him a major disadvantage in combat. However, now it is much easier to tame..
This dragon is strong. He grows faster and is superior to his foes in combat.
This dragon is weak. He grows slower and is inferior to his foes in combat.
This dragon has an enourmous wingspan making him very fast. In old age, the dragon will cover towns in a dark shadow.
This dragon has a smaller wingspan, making it smaller overall. It may struggle in flight and battle as he is slower compared to other dragons.
This dragon is slothful. He wants to stay in a lair and avoid unnecessary actionsmaking, making it easier to tame him.
This dragon has large, razor-sharp claws that will tear at dragonscales and humans with ease, making the dragon a formidable opponent.
This dragon has smaller claws that will struggle to tear at dragonscales and will be less useful in battle, putting this dragon at a disadvantage.
The scales of this dragon are thicker than normal. They will not be penetrated by any projectile and dragon claws will struggle against the thickness of the scales.
The scales of this dragon are thinner than normal. They will be penetrated easier by larger projectiles and dragon claws easily cut against the thin scales.
This is a black dragon egg. It was laid by a dragon and can be hatched.
This is a black dragon egg. It was laid by a dragon and can be hatched.
This is a black dragon egg. It was laid by a dragon and can be hatched.
This is a grey dragon egg. It was laid by a dragon and can be hatched.
This is a black dragon egg. It was laid by a dragon and can be hatched.
This is a violet dragon egg. It was laid by a dragon and can be hatched.
This is a black dragon egg. It was laid by a dragon and can be hatched.
This is a yellow dragon egg. It was laid by a dragon and can be hatched.
Dragons are powerful creatures. If I manage to obtain a dragon egg and raise the hatchling my enemies will tremble when we meet on the battlefield.
[Root.GetFirstName] wants to tame a dragon. However, taming a dragon is dangerous. Those not having the blood of Valyria in their veins have a low chance to succeed.
Disabled on default since they are heavily WIP.
Us at your own risk. Expect bugs. Heavily WIP.
Not intended for gameplay but for bug fixing..
